attributes.comment:
On the fee increase

I think that it was not wise or just for Congress to make CIS a fee based agency.
If we require people to wait for at least five years to be eligible to apply for
citizenship and make them pay taxes all those years and then raise the fee every
two years, it sends the wrong signal to people. The government should subsidize
or keep at a token level fees for services like this. Where is their tax money
going? If Congress people could allocate money for retirement and health care
benefits for themselves and their spouses, why not for the naturalization fee of tax
payers? If there is money for wasteful spending, subsidy for farmers, etc, for
IRAQ, for legal services of prisoners why not for naturalization applications for
taxpayers?
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Ed G. Valladares
